content.description: Start on the far left of the Riverside Face and traverse low through good holds. You can stay low all the way to round the corner, or turn upward and climb up the topout.

This climbs up through the notch at the crux of Island Vibes Free Dive, through some decent holds. The first day we started cleaning up the boulder and surrounding area we noticed some chalk here, but do not know who claimed first ascent.

Sit start on small but "obvious holds" to the right of

Roadside Rich

, go straight up through crimps to gain larger holds and the lip. Some holds have broken, may have jumped a grade.
Start low and left on some good holds, then shoot for a right hand side pull and work your way up through jugs. The further right you go the more value you get out of the top-out.
Start low on the rightmost corner of the Roadside Face, climbing up through the blocky arete to gain the apex jug. Escape right at any point for a vB rating.

Two move wonder, about 8ft to the right of

Beautiful.

Sit start low on some good holds and reach up left to a sloper. Use a little body tension to either gain an intermediate right hand, or fire for a decent jug straight up. Easy top-out.

Start low the far right side of the Roadside Face, right hand on a huge jug around the corner and left hand on a small crimp with a thumb-catch. Work your way left and up the face, avoiding the arete. Finish either on the apex jug, or the jugs further to the left.

Start on the flat rail on the far left of the Roadside Face (same as

Crazy Rich Asians

), pull into

Roadside Rich

and move up and right towards the apex jug.

Start low on some good low holds by the orange lichen, pull up right through some crimps and pinches, trying to climb up as straight as possible and head for the flat jug at the apex of the face. This climb was first known as "

Rich as Plumline Puddin

," as it tracks straight up the tallest line on the entire face.

Start on the same holds as

Roadside Rich

, but skip the lower right sidepull and launch for the jug above it. Match and make one more big move to the lip. Two move wonder, quick and fun!

Start at jugs or a no-hands rest at the start of

Roadside Arete

and move right through the large rails to a cruxy second half, dropping down and low before exploding out right for a good jug, then either climb up for the top-out, or cross through to pull around the corner to the start holds of the

Yoga Nidra Traverse

.

Variant of

The Proposal

. Start dead center of the face with right hand on the good sidepull. Use leverage to make a big left move (fun!), then finish up

The Proposal

to the apex jug.

Do

Crazy Rich Asians

on the Roadside Face, link into

Island Vibes Free Dive

on the Dirty Backside, then the

Yoga Nidra Traverse

on the Riverside Face, and finish circumnavigating the boulder by staying low on the walk-off face and return to the start hold.

The grade depends on how much you milk the rests, and how low you stay throughout the traverse (particularly across the final face, which is challenging as a butt-dragger, or silly easy if your feet are above the lip)
Sit start on the far left of the Dirty Backside, pull up and fire for the big rail at head-height and top out.

Start matched on a large flat rail on the far left of the Roadside face, sit-starting with your backside on the backbreaker boulder that serves as a step down the walk-off. Lift off and make your way right through the starting moves for Roadside Rich, cutting low across the face to gain the blocky arete on the far right side where you can take a no-hands rest. Drop off here or top-out the easy arete if you'd like, or link into the

Island Vibes Free Dive

Traverse and/or go for the full

Exxon Valdez

for more challenge.

Sit start with the left hand on the right-hand start hold for

Dirty.

Right hand starts on a good hold. Pull up and gain the same rail for a low top-out.
